newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Quadruple murder suspect arrested in France.
newsitem.headline: Quadruple murder suspect arrested in France.

text.p: A man wanted for questioning in connection with the murders earlier this month of a woman and her three daughters has been arrested in southern France, Belgian radio reported on Sunday.
Dutch-language radio station BRTN said Remy Lecrenier was arrested by French police at a camp site near Saint Tropez.
He had been on a Belgian police "wanted" list since July 8, after the bodies of a woman and her three daughters were found at a house in the small hamlet of Bas-Oha, eastern Belgium.
All four victims had been shot in the back of the head, while the eldest daughter had also been struck through the chest with a crossbow.
At the time, police said they were seeking the jilted boyfriend of one of the daughters to help with the investigation.
